posts.name: Drew B.
posts.cooked:
I’ve had a few teams reach out and ask about receiving Onshape Associate Certification Exam voucher codes for their students, so it’s worth highlighting here as well.

As part of PTC’s Virtual Kit of Parts donation this year, we’ve set up a request form for teams to receive up to 5 Onshape Associate Exam vouchers. These can be used by any member of the recipient team.

If you want to request voucher codes, fill out the form linked here.

If you’re going to take the exam, don’t forget to check out the practice exam , too!

posts.name: Chris Cross
posts.cooked: This sounds great @Drew_B and we really appreciate the support that Onshape gives to FIRST and teams. For those of us not in the know, what does having an Onshape Associate Certification mean?  I have a few students who seem to be very fluent with Onshape and if this certification can help them in anyway, I’d love to let them know that this is a thing. Thanks!

posts.name: Drew B.
posts.cooked:
Great question. The Onshape Associate Certification establishes that a user has strong proficiencies in part modeling, basic assembly design, and drawing knowledge. The exam was built to test users on the skills that an entry-level design engineer will need if they want to hit the ground running in a design role. It’s also an industry-recognized certification and is listed in multiple different states.

With how competitive college and internship applications are nowadays, earning certifications like this is one more way for a student to stand out.

posts.name: Alex S
posts.cooked: Is there a listing of things students should know or particular curriculum they should go through in OnShape prior to taking the exam?

posts.name: wilsonmw04
posts.cooked:
Drew_B:

If you want to request voucher codes, fill out the form linked here.

I can’t get the link to work. anything special we have to do?

posts.name: Chris Cross
posts.cooked: I’m sure that someone else is much more knowledgeable about this than I am, but here is a link to a page explaining the certification. Certified Onshape Associate Exam

posts.name: Drew B.
posts.cooked:
Yes, there is. The Certified Onshape Associate page in the Learning Center has a list of topics as well as a some recommended courses in the Learning Center. If a given student or mentor can cruise through those LC courses with ease, they’ll be fine for the exam. The practice exam documentation also dives pretty heavily into the specifics of each section and what skills are needed for each.

In my own experience, the biggest reason why users have not passed the exam is due to time. They know the necessary steps, but have not spent enough time using Onshape to quickly work through each question. I’ve also seen plenty of FRC students cruise through the 3-hour exam in well under 2 hours.

posts.name: Drew B.
posts.cooked: Mmm, not that I’m aware of. It’s an Airtable form link. It’s also accessible from the Kit of Parts Page under PTC/Onshape’s section . Would you mind trying it from there to see if it behaves differently?

posts.name: wilsonmw04
posts.cooked: can confirm the KOP link works.

posts.name: Ethan
posts.cooked: Are voucher codes still available now/heading into the next season?

posts.name: Drew B.
posts.cooked: Yep, the form is still active at this link . When the new virtual kit comes out, we’ll have a new list of voucher codes to pull from and will run a similar 5 codes/team donation.

posts.name: billbo911
posts.cooked:
I have four students, plus myself, that are interested in earning the certification. None of us are ready as we have just started the training tutorials. Additionally, I would like them to use Onshape for at least one competition season, off season or on, either will suffice.

So, the question is, if I request the codes now, will they still be valid in 4 months? Either that, or we just wait for the 2026 KoP and get the vouchers next spring. What would you suggest?
